definition.name: exp

text.english:
Let \( \texttt{exp} : \mathcal{N}Term \to \mathcal{N}Term \) be defined as follows:
  • Base Clause: \( \texttt{exp}(Z, m) = m \)
  • Inductive Clause: \( \texttt{exp}(S(n), m) = \texttt{mul}(\texttt{exp}(n,m)), m) \).
text.italiano:
Sia \( \texttt{exp} : \mathcal{N}Term \to \mathcal{N}Term \) definito come segue:
  • Clausola Base: \( \texttt{exp}(Z, m) = m \)
  • Clausola Induttiva: \( \texttt{exp}(S(n), m)) = \texttt{mul}(\texttt{exp}(n,m)), m) \).

definition.coq: Fixpoint exp (n m : nterm) : nterm := match n with | Z => S Z | S n' => mul (exp n' m) m end.
